title: Mamacita's Mexican Rice Recipe
description: This quick and easy Mexican rice dish pan-fries white rice, onion, and garlic followed by simmering with chicken broth and tomatoes for a Mexican-inspired side dish.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Vegetables Green Peas Mamacita's Mexican Rice 4.5 (83) 72 Reviews 21 Photos My mother-in-law gave me this basic Mexican rice recipe that I've updated. Here it is. Submitted by Armi Updated on November 17, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 21 21 21 21 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 6 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 cup long-grain white rice 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1 onion, minced 1 clove garlic, minced 1 ½ cups chicken broth 1 tomato, seeded and diced ½ teaspoon ground cumin ½ teaspoon Spanish saffron salt and ground black pepper to taste ¼ cup frozen peas and carrots, thawed 1 sprig fresh cilantro (Optional) Directions Cook and stir rice and oil in a skillet over medium heat until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes. Add onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Pour chicken broth into rice mixture and bring to a boil; stir tomato, cumin, saffron, salt, and black pepper into broth and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer until rice is cooked, about 20 minutes. Stir peas and carrots into cooked rice; garnish with cilantro. I Made It Print 183 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 156 Calories 3g Fat 30g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 156 % Daily Value * Total Fat 3g 3% Saturated Fat 0g 2% Sodium 34mg 1% Total Carbohydrate 30g 11% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 1g Protein 3g 6% Vitamin C 5mg 6% Calcium 20mg 2% Iron 1mg 8% Potassium 128mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Mamacita's Mexican Rice 01 of 21 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 21 Photo by  DREGINEK 12/23/2024 I think this is more of a Spanish Rice than. Mexican- thanks mostly to the saffron. As I added the peas and carrots, which are not in any Mexican rice dishes I’ve had before - reminded me of paella…and tasted similarly too. All that said; it is very good and pretty easy to make. Thanks Armi! 03 of 21 Photo by  Sherry 09/02/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Winner for sure. Delicious rice recipe. I did make home made saffron to add to this recipe, 04 of 21 Photo by  stefina 01/14/2022 I made this recipe, but I did add canned tomatoes instead of fresh. It was so delicious. 05 of 21 Photo by  PeppyMead7693 10/19/2020 06 of 21 Photo by  Lorelei 08/10/2020 I made this as a side dish to tacos, and I really liked this recipe! I didn’t have any saffron, and decided to opt out of frozen veggies and instead used a fresh garden carrot that I diced and put in the dish at the same time as the tomatoes (I didn’t want crunchy carrots). I will make this dish again! 07 of 21 Photo by  Lorelei 08/10/2020 I made this as a side dish to tacos, and I really liked this recipe! I didn’t have any saffron, and decided to opt out of frozen veggies and instead used a fresh garden carrot that I diced and put in the dish at the same time as the tomatoes (I didn’t want crunchy carrots). I will make this dish again! 08 of 21 Photo by  PreciousVeal 03/26/2020 09 of 21 Photo by  Adrianne Porcelli 02/01/2020 Yum!! Super fat and really yummy. I didn’t have a fresh tomato on hand, so I used 1/2 c of salsa. Turned our great! Very moist :) 10 of 21 Photo by  Judy Jordan 02/25/2018 I didn't add the carrots, but I did add the some chopped cilantro just before serving along with some chopped fresh parsley. 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Colorado Mexican Rice 23 Ratings Turmeric Rice with Peas and Carrots 17 Ratings Mexican White Rice 53 Ratings Low-Fat Celery and Peas with Cream 5 Ratings Stir Fried Snow Peas and Mushrooms 93 Ratings Becky's Easy Cilantro Lime Rice 52 Ratings Quinoa with Peas and Parmesan 47 Ratings Matar Pulao (Rice with Peas) 42 Ratings Sugar Snap Peas with Mint 157 Ratings Brown Spanish Rice 23 Ratings Jicama Corn Salad 16 Ratings Mexican Tomato Rice 227 Ratings First Baby Food: Peas 7 Ratings Baked Vegetable Rice Pilaf 14 Ratings Cilantro-Lime Rice 214 Ratings Chole Saag 77 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Armi
instructions: Cook and stir rice and oil in a skillet over medium heat until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes. Add onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.;Pour chicken broth into rice mixture and bring to a boil; stir tomato, cumin, saffron, salt, and black pepper into broth and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer until rice is cooked, about 20 minutes.;Stir peas and carrots into cooked rice; garnish with cilantro.
